item.title: Microsoft: New Windows updates fix Active Directory policy issues
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has released emergency Windows updates to address a known issue affecting local audit logon policies in Active Directory Group Policy. [...]

item.title: OpenAI's GPT-4.1, 4.1 nano, and 4.1 mini models release imminent
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: According to references spotted on OpenAI's website, the Microsoft-backed AI startup is planning to launch five new models this week, including GPT-4.1, 4.1 nano, and 4.1 mini. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Windows Server 2025 restarts break connectivity on some DCs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft warned IT admins that some Windows Server 2025 domain controllers might become inaccessible after a restart, causing apps and services to fail or remain unreachable. [...]

item.title: Chrome 136 fixes 20-year browser history privacy risk
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: ​Google is fixing a long-standing privacy issue that, for years, enabled websites to determine users' browsing history through the previously visited links. [...]

item.title: Leak confirms OpenAI's GPT 4.1 is coming before GPT 5.0
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is working on yet another AI model reportedly called GPT-4.1, a successor to GPT-4o, which is expected to come before GPT 5.0 [...]

item.title: Tycoon2FA phishing kit targets Microsoft 365 with new tricks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Phishing-as-a-service (PhaaS) platform Tycoon2FA, known for bypassing multi-factor authentication on Microsoft 365 and Gmail accounts, has received updates that improve its stealth and evasion capabilities. [...]

item.title: AI-hallucinated code dependencies become new supply chain risk
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new class of supply chain attacks named 'slopsquatting' has emerged from the increased use of generative AI tools for coding and the model's tendency to "hallucinate" non-existent package names. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Defender will isolate undiscovered endpoints to block attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is testing a new Defender for Endpoint capability that will block traffic to and from undiscovered endpoints to thwart attackers' lateral network movement attempts. [...]

item.title: Microsoft starts final Windows Recall testing before rollout
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft is gradually rolling out the AI-powered Windows Recall feature to Insiders in the Release Preview channel before making it generally available to all Windows users with Copilot+ PCs. [...]

item.title: Western Sydney University discloses security breaches, data leak
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Western Sydney University (WSU) announced two security incidents that exposed personal information belonging to members of its community. [...]

item.title: Fortinet: Hackers retain access to patched FortiGate VPNs using symlinks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Fortinet warns that threat actors use a post-exploitation technique that helps them maintain read-only access to previously compromised FortiGate VPN devices even after the original attack vector was patched. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Windows 'inetpub' folder created by security fix, don’t delete
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has now confirmed that an April 2025 Windows security update is creating a new empty "inetpub" folder and warned users not to delete it. [...]
